intro: Bossiaea spinosa, commonly known as the spiny bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, spiny leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils in coastal and inland regions. It is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in sunny conditions. Bossiaea spinosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
